poem:
**Collateral Correspondence**

Through tangled wires, a whisper slips,  
a private echo echoed loud—  
a slip of text, a headline found,  
where tender words become sharp scripts.  
Love's quiet realm, softly breached,  
in political storms, hearts beseeched.  
The paper cuts; he winces.  
In public woe, the private winces.

In extracts of a new BBC podcast about politics hosted by Gove, the former Tory minister and MP said this was particularly the case when an email in 2016 from Vine offering advice to her then-husband was accidentally sent to other". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
